Class Piece

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece extends Object
Abstract base class representing a chess piece. All specific piece types (Pawn, Knight, Bishop, Rook, Queen, King) extend this class.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Jacob Sierra and Robert Zamora

  • Constructor Details

    • Piece

      public Piece(String color, Position position)
      Constructs a Piece with the specified color and position.
      Parameters:
      color - the color of the piece ("white" or "black")
      position - the initial position of the piece

  • Method Details

    • getColor

      public String getColor()
      Gets the color of this piece.
      Returns:
      the piece's color ("white" or "black")

    • getPosition

      public Position getPosition()
      Gets the current position of this piece.
      Returns:
      the piece's position

    • move

      public void move(Position newPosition)
      Moves this piece to a new position and marks it as having moved. This method is called by the Board after a move is validated.
      Parameters:
      newPosition - the new position for this piece

    • hasMoved

      public boolean hasMoved()
      Checks if this piece has been moved from its starting position. Used for castling and pawn two-square move validation.
      Returns:
      true if the piece has moved, false otherwise

    • possibleMoves

      public abstract List<Position> possibleMoves(Piece[][] board)
      Calculates all possible moves for this piece given the current board state. This method must be implemented by each specific piece type.
      Parameters:
      board - the current board state as a 2D array
      Returns:
      a list of all possible destination positions

    • toString

      public abstract String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this piece for display purposes.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a 2-3 character string representing the piece (e.g., "wp", "bK")
